comments:
Every now and then subclasses of generic classes will suddenly get a syntax
error in Eclipse with a message like 'Bound mismatch: The type X is not a valid
substitute for the bounded parameter <T extends Y> of the type Z<T>'; where X is
a subclass of Y and Z has nothing to do with it.
The error seems to come up at random and disappears when I clean and rebuild
my project.
